result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Bond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *With credit for FOURTEEN (14) DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges BY 04-10-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

*Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion. EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Bond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TI SHERYL B,OS
NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITION FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILED. OS
Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations. ew
REVOKED - Sentenced to Co. jail/HOC.  Filed, sdg.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FOURTEEN (14) DAYS time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the Victim.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges BY 04-10-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with Student Intern Tony Kim under attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Derrick Bond in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services.  Filed, sdg.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Derrick Bond in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant is FIVE (5) HOURS short of completing the Community Service requirement.  State advised that they were going to REVOKE at this hearing if the Defendant did not show proof of Community Service.  State moved for a Bench Warrant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services.  Filed, sdg.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Defendant Derrick Bond in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense requested that any Warrant issued be STAYED pending her investigation.  Defense has had contact with the Defendant through Judy B of the OSPD.  State advised that given the JusticePoint Non-compliance Report,  they are asking for a Warrant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.  If Defense can contact Defendant,  Court authorized Defense to bring the Defendant in before this Court.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Community service needs to be completed. Case adjourned for a Final Pretrial Hearing in Branch 33.  Final Review hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court, defendant Derrick Bond not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant did not appear at the previous hearing as he was worried about not having completed Community Service.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $250.00 PR BOND.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Derrick Bond in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  lnr.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense requested that any Warrant issued be STAYED.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised the Court that Defendant is volunteering at ACE BOXING & CO.  Defendant is scheduled to graduate High School in the Summer.  State reiterated the need for completion for Community Service.  Defendant needs to complete TWENTY (20) HOURS of Community Service.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Review hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(from) Case Manager Perry to the Defense.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State reports that Defendant needs to complete TWENTY (20) HOURS of Community Service.  Defense advises that Defendant will be completing Community Service.  Review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(from) St. Anne's.  Filed, sdg.
(from) Defendant to Victim.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant has obtained employment and that Defendant is residing with his mother.  Defendant needs to complete 20 (TWENTY) hours of Community Service.  Court adjourns matter to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court reviewed the report.  Defendant needs to complete 20 hours of community service and submit the letter of apology.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 33.
Defendant was in Lad Lake.  Case is adjourned to Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  Defendant to provide documentation.  Case adjourned for review hearing to Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

student Intern Nicole Brendvehl under the supervision of Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is currently in a treatment facility.  Court continues the stayed warrant.  Calendar call scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

  Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant Derrick Bond in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court vacates the stayed warrant.  Court previously reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Court continues the stay on the warrant.    Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Calendar Call / Initial Appearance.  Calendar call scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 4/6/15 @ 8:30am
